info.title: Teku
info.description: A minimal API specification for the beacon node, which enables a validator to connect and perform its obligations on the Ethereum beacon chain.

get.description: Retrieve details of the chain's genesis which can be used to identify chain.

404.description: Chain genesis info is not yet known

get.description: Calculates HashTreeRoot for state with given 'state_id'. If stateId is root, same value will be returned.

parameters.name: state_id
parameters.description: State identifier. Can be one of: "head" (canonical head in node's view), "genesis", "finalized", "justified", <slot>, <hex encoded stateRoot with 0x prefix>.

get.description: Returns Fork object for state with given 'state_id'.

parameters.name: state_id
parameters.description: State identifier. Can be one of: "head" (canonical head in node's view), "genesis", "finalized", "justified", <slot>, <hex encoded stateRoot with 0x prefix>.

get.description: Returns finality checkpoints for state with given 'state_id'. In case finality is not yet achieved, checkpoint should return epoch 0 and ZERO_HASH as root.

parameters.name: state_id
parameters.description: State identifier. Can be one of: "head" (canonical head in node's view), "genesis", "finalized", "justified", <slot>, <hex encoded stateRoot with 0x prefix>.

get.description: Returns filterable list of validators with their balance, status and index.

parameters.name: state_id
parameters.description: State identifier. Can be one of: "head" (canonical head in node's view), "genesis", "finalized", "justified", <slot>, <hex encoded stateRoot with 0x prefix>.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Either hex encoded public key (with 0x prefix) or validator index

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: valid values:   pending_initialized,   pending_queued,   active_ongoing,   active_exiting,   active_slashed,   exited_unslashed,   exited_slashed,   withdrawal_possible,   withdrawal_done

503.description: Beacon node is currently syncing and not serving requests

get.description: Returns validator specified by state and id or public key along with status and balance.

parameters.name: state_id
parameters.description: State identifier. Can be one of: "head" (canonical head in node's view), "genesis", "finalized", "justified", <slot>, <hex encoded stateRoot with 0x prefix>.

parameters.name: validator_id
parameters.description: Either hex encoded public key (with 0x prefix) or validator index

503.description: Beacon node is currently syncing and not serving requests

get.description: Returns filterable list of validator balances.

parameters.name: state_id
parameters.description: State identifier. Can be one of: "head" (canonical head in node's view), "genesis", "finalized", "justified", <slot>, <hex encoded stateRoot with 0x prefix>.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Either hex encoded public key (with 0x prefix) or validator index

get.description: Retrieves the committees for the given state.

parameters.name: state_id
parameters.description: State identifier. Can be one of: "head" (canonical head in node's view), "genesis", "finalized", "justified", <slot>, <hex encoded stateRoot with 0x prefix>.

parameters.name: epoch
parameters.description: `uint64` Epoch number to query.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: `uint64` Committee index to query.

parameters.name: slot
parameters.description: `UInt64` Slot to query in the canonical chain.

get.description: Retrieves the sync committees for the given state.

parameters.name: state_id
parameters.description: State identifier. Can be one of: "head" (canonical head in node's view), "genesis", "finalized", "justified", <slot>, <hex encoded stateRoot with 0x prefix>.

parameters.name: epoch
parameters.description: `uint64` Epoch number to query.

get.description: Retrieves block headers matching given query. By default it will fetch current head slot blocks.

parameters.name: parent_root
parameters.description: Not currently supported.

get.description: Retrieves block header for given block id.

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: Block identifier. Can be one of: "head" (canonical head in node's view), "genesis", "finalized", <slot>, <hex encoded blockRoot with 0x prefix>.

post.description: Submit a signed beacon block to the beacon node to be imported. The beacon node performs the required validation.

200.description: Block has been successfully broadcast, validated and imported.

202.description: Block has been successfully broadcast, but failed validation and has not been imported.

415.description: Unsupported media-type supplied in request body.

500.description: Beacon node experienced an internal error.

503.description: Beacon node is currently syncing.

post.description: Submit a signed blinded beacon block to the beacon node to be imported. The beacon node performs the required validation.

200.description: Block has been successfully broadcast, validated and imported.

202.description: Block has been successfully broadcast, but failed validation and has not been imported.

415.description: Unsupported media-type supplied in request body.

500.description: Beacon node experienced an internal error.

503.description: Beacon node is currently syncing.

get.description:
Retrieves block details for given block id.

__NOTE__: only phase 0 blocks are returned, use `/eth/v2/beacon/blocks/{block_id}` for multiple milestone support.

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: Block identifier. Can be one of: "head" (canonical head in node's view), "genesis", "finalized", <slot>, <hex encoded blockRoot with 0x prefix>.

get.description: Retrieves block details for given block id.

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: Block identifier. Can be one of: "head" (canonical head in node's view), "genesis", "finalized", <slot>, <hex encoded blockRoot with 0x prefix>.

get.description: Returns the latest finalized BeaconState.

503.description: Beacon node is currently syncing and not serving requests

get.description: Retrieves hashTreeRoot of BeaconBlock/BeaconBlockHeader

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: Block identifier. Can be one of: "head" (canonical head in node's view), "genesis", "finalized", <slot>, <hex encoded blockRoot with 0x prefix>.

get.description: Retrieves hashTreeRoot of the finalized beacon block

parameters.name: slot
parameters.description: The slot for which the block should be proposed.

get.description: Retrieves attestations included in requested block.

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: Block identifier. Can be one of: "head" (canonical head in node's view), "genesis", "finalized", <slot>, <hex encoded blockRoot with 0x prefix>.

get.description: Retrieves attestations known by the node but not necessarily incorporated into any block.

parameters.name: slot
parameters.description: `UInt64` Slot to query in the canonical chain.

parameters.name: committee_index
parameters.description: `uint64` Committee index to query.

post.description:
Submit signed attestations to the beacon node to be validated and submitted if valid.

This endpoint does not protected against slashing.

200.description: The Attestation was accepted, validated, and submitted

400.description: Errors with one or more sync committee messages

get.description: Retrieves attester slashings known by the node but not necessarily incorporated into any block.

post.description: Submits attester slashing object to node's pool and if passes validation node MUST broadcast it to network.

200.description: Attester Slashing has been successfully validated, added to the pool, and broadcast.

400.description: Invalid attester slashing, it will never pass validation so it's rejected

get.description: Retrieves proposer slashings known by the node but not necessarily incorporated into any block.

post.description: Submits proposer slashing object to node's pool and if passes validation node MUST broadcast it to network.

200.description: Proposer Slashing has been successfully validated, added to the pool, and broadcast.

400.description: Invalid proposer slashing, it will never pass validation so it's rejected

get.description: Retrieves voluntary exits known by the node but not necessarily incorporated into any block.

post.description: Submits signed voluntary exit object to node's pool and if it passes validation node MUST broadcast it to network.

200.description: Signed voluntary exit has been successfully validated, added to the pool, and broadcast.

400.description: Invalid voluntary exit, it will never pass validation so it's rejected

post.summary: Submit sync committee messages to node
post.description:
Submits sync committee message objects to the node.

Sync committee messages are not present in phase0, but are required for Altair networks.

If a sync committee message is validated successfully the node MUST publish that sync committee message on all applicable subnets.

If one or more sync committee messages fail validation the node MUST return a 400 error with details of which sync committee messages have failed, and why.

200.description: The sync committee messages were accepted, validated, and submitted

400.description: Errors with one or more sync committee messages

post.description: Requests the beacon node to indicate if a validator has been    observed to be live in a given epoch. The beacon node might detect liveness by    observing messages from the validator on the network, in the beacon chain,    from its API or from any other source. It is important to note that the    values returned by the beacon node are not canonical; they are best-effort    and based upon a subjective view of the network.

503.description: Beacon node is currently syncing and not serving requests

get.description:
Provides endpoint to subscribe to beacon node Server-Sent-Events stream. Consumers should use [eventsource](https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/server-sent-events.html#the-eventsource-interface) implementation to listen on those events.

Servers _may_ send SSE comments beginning with `:` for any purpose, including to keep the event stream connection alive in the presence of proxy servers.

parameters.name: topics
parameters.description: Event types to subscribe to. Available values include: [`head`, `finalized_checkpoint`, `chain_reorg`, `block`, `attestation`, `voluntary_exit`, `contribution_and_proof`]

get.description: Returns node health status in http status codes. Useful for load balancers.

parameters.name: syncing_status
parameters.description: Customize syncing status instead of default status code (206)

206.description: Node is syncing but can serve incomplete data

503.description: Node not initialized or having issues

get.description: Retrieves data about the node's network presence.

200.description: The identifying information of the node.

get.description: Retrieves data about the node's network peers.
Retrieves number of known peers.
Retrieves data about the given peer.

parameters.name: peer_id
parameters.description: Cryptographic hash of a peerâ€™s public key. [Read more](https://docs.libp2p.io/concepts/peer-id/)

get.description: Requests the beacon node to describe if it's currently syncing or not, and if it is, what block it is up to.
similar to [HTTP User-Agent](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-5.5.3).

post.description:
Requests the beacon node to provide a set of attestation duties, which should be performed by validators, for a particular epoch. Duties should only need to be checked once per epoch, however a chain reorganization (of > MIN_SEED_LOOKAHEAD epochs) could occur, resulting in a change of duties. For full safety, you should monitor head events and confirm the dependent root in this response matches:
- event.previous_duty_dependent_root when `compute_epoch_at_slot(event.slot) == epoch`
- event.current_duty_dependent_root when `compute_epoch_at_slot(event.slot) + 1 == epoch`
- event.block otherwise

The dependent_root value is `get_block_root_at_slot(state, compute_start_slot_at_epoch(epoch - 1) - 1)` or the genesis block root in the case of underflow.

requestBody.description:
An array of the validator indices for which to obtain the duties.

```
[
  "(uint64)",
  ...
]
```

503.description: Beacon node is currently syncing and not serving requests

get.description:
Request beacon node to provide all validators that are scheduled to propose a block in the given epoch.

Duties should only need to be checked once per epoch, however a chain reorganization could occur that results in a change of duties. For full safety, you should monitor head events and confirm the dependent root in this response matches:
- event.current_duty_dependent_root when `compute_epoch_at_slot(event.slot) == epoch`
- event.block otherwise

The dependent_root value is `get_block_root_at_slot(state, compute_start_slot_at_epoch(epoch) - 1)` or the genesis block root in the case of underflow.

503.description: Beacon node is currently syncing and not serving requests

get.description:
Requests a beacon node to produce a valid block, which can then be signed by a validator.

__NOTE__: deprecated, switch to using `/eth/v2/validator/blocks/{slot}` for multiple milestone support.

parameters.name: slot
parameters.description: The slot for which the block should be proposed.

parameters.name: randao_reveal
parameters.description: `BLSSignature Hex` BLS12-381 signature for the current epoch.

parameters.name: graffiti
parameters.description: `Bytes32 Hex` Graffiti.

503.description: Beacon node is currently syncing and not serving requests

get.description: Requests a beacon node to produce a valid block, which can then be signed by a validator.

parameters.name: slot
parameters.description: The slot for which the block should be proposed.

parameters.name: randao_reveal
parameters.description: `BLSSignature Hex` BLS12-381 signature for the current epoch.

parameters.name: graffiti
parameters.description: `Bytes32 Hex` Graffiti.

503.description: Beacon node is currently syncing and not serving requests

get.description:
Requests a beacon node to produce a valid blinded block, which can then be signed by a validator. A blinded block is a block with only a transactions root, rather than a full transactions list.

Metadata in the response indicates the type of block produced, and the supported types of block will be added to as forks progress.

Pre-Bellatrix, this endpoint will return a `BeaconBlock`.

parameters.name: slot
parameters.description: The slot for which the block should be proposed.

parameters.name: randao_reveal
parameters.description: `BLSSignature Hex` BLS12-381 signature for the current epoch.

parameters.name: graffiti
parameters.description: `Bytes32 Hex` Graffiti.

503.description: Beacon node is currently syncing and not serving requests

get.description:
Returns attestation data for the block at the specified non-finalized slot.

This endpoint is not protected against slashing. Signing the returned attestation data can result in a slashable offence.

parameters.name: slot
parameters.description: `uint64` The slot for which an attestation data should be created.

parameters.name: committee_index
parameters.description: `Integer` The committee index for which an attestation data should be created.

503.description: Beacon node is currently syncing and not serving requests

get.description: Aggregates all attestations matching given attestation data root and slot.

parameters.name: attestation_data_root
parameters.description: `String` HashTreeRoot of AttestationData that validator wants aggregated.

parameters.name: slot
parameters.description: `uint64` Non-finalized slot for which to create the aggregation.

200.description: Returns aggregated `Attestation` object with same `AttestationData` root.

403.description: Beacon node was not assigned to aggregate on that subnet

post.description: Verifies given aggregate and proofs and publishes it on appropriate gossipsub topic.

After Beacon node receives this request, search using discv5 for peers related to this subnet and replace current peers with those ones if necessary If validator is_aggregator, beacon node must:
- announce subnet topic subscription on gossipsub
- aggregate attestations received on that subnet

200.description: Slot signature is valid and beacon node has prepared the attestation subnet. Note that, there is no guarantee the node will find peers for the subnet

503.description: Beacon node is currently syncing and not serving requests

post.description: Requests the beacon node to provide a set of sync committee duties

requestBody.description:
An array of the validator indices for which to obtain the duties.

```
[
  "(uint64)",
  ...
]
```

503.description: Beacon node is currently syncing and not serving requests

get.description: Returns a `SyncCommitteeContribution` that is the aggregate of `SyncCommitteeMessage` values known to this node matching the specified slot, subcommittee index and beacon block root.

parameters.name: slot
parameters.description: `uint64` The slot for which a sync committee contribution should be created.

parameters.name: subcommittee_index
parameters.description: `uint64` The subcommittee index for which to produce the contribution.

parameters.name: beacon_block_root
parameters.description: `bytes32` The block root for which to produce the contribution.

404.description: No matching sync committee messages were found

post.summary: Subscribe to a Sync committee subnet
post.description:
Subscribe to a number of sync committee subnets

Sync committees are not present in phase0, but are required for Altair networks.

Subscribing to sync committee subnets is an action performed by VC to enable network participation in Altair networks, and only required if the VC has an active validator in an active sync committee.
Verifies given sync committee contribution and proofs and publishes on appropriate gossipsub topics.

Prepares the beacon node for potential proposers by supplying information required when proposing blocks for the given validators. The information supplied for each validator index is considered persistent until overwritten by new information for the given validator index, or until the beacon node restarts.

Note that because the information is not persistent across beacon node restarts it is recommended that either the beacon node is monitored for restarts or this information is refreshed by resending this request periodically (for example, each epoch).

Also note that requests containing currently inactive or unknown validator indices will be accepted, as they may become active at a later epoch.

Prepares the beacon node for potential proposers by supplying information required when proposing blocks for the given validators. The information supplied for each validator index is considered persistent until overwritten by new information for the given validator index, or until the beacon node restarts.

Note that because the information is not persistent across beacon node restarts it is recommended that either the beacon node is monitored for restarts or this information is refreshed by resending this request periodically (for example, each epoch).

Also note that registrations for exited validators will be filtered out and not sent to the builder network. However, registrations for inactive or unknown validators will be sent, as they may become active at a later epoch.

get.description: Retrieve deposit contract address and genesis fork version.
Retrieve all scheduled upcoming forks this node is aware of.
Retrieve specification configuration used on this node.

Retrieves all possible chain heads (leaves of fork choice tree).

Deprecated - use `/eth/v2/debug/beacon/heads
Retrieves all possible chain heads (leaves of fork choice tree).

Use Accept header to select `application/octet-stream` if SSZ response type is required.

parameters.description: State identifier. Can be one of: "head" (canonical head in node's view), "genesis", "finalized", "justified", <slot>, <hex encoded stateRoot with 0x prefix>.

genesis_time.description: The genesis_time configured for the beacon node, which is the unix time in seconds at which the Eth2.0 chain began.

activation_eligibility_epoch.description: When criteria for activation were met.

activation_epoch.description: Epoch when validator activated. 'FAR_FUTURE_EPOCH' if not activated.

exit_epoch.description: Epoch when validator exited. 'FAR_FUTURE_EPOCH' if not exited.

withdrawable_epoch.description: When validator can withdraw or transfer funds. 'FAR_FUTURE_EPOCH' if not defined.

index.description: Index of validator in validator registry.
Index of validator in validator registry.

slot.description: The slot at which the committee has to attest.

peer_id.description: Cryptographic hash of a peerâ€™s public key. [Read more](https://docs.libp2p.io/concepts/peer-id/)

p2p_addresses.description: Node's addresses on which eth2 rpc requests are served. [Read more](https://docs.libp2p.io/reference/glossary/#multiaddr)

discovery_addresses.description: Node's addresses on which is listening for discv5 requests. [Read more](https://docs.libp2p.io/reference/glossary/#multiaddr)

seq_number.description: Uint64 starting at 0 used to version the node's metadata. If any other field in the local MetaData changes, the node MUST increment seq_number by 1.

attnets.description: Bitvector representing the node's persistent attestation subnet subscriptions.

syncnets.description: Bitvector representing the node's persistent attestation subnet subscriptions.

peer_id.description: Cryptographic hash of a peerâ€™s public key. '[Read more](https://docs.libp2p.io/concepts/peer-id/)

enr.description: Ethereum node record. Not currently populated. [Read more](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-778)

last_seen_p2p_address.description: Multiaddr used in last peer connection. [Read more](https://docs.libp2p.io/reference/glossary/#multiaddr)

sync_distance.description: How many slots node needs to process to reach head. 0 if synced.

is_syncing.description: Set to true if the node is syncing, false if the node is synced.

is_optimistic.description: Set to true if the node is optimistically fetching blocks.

version.description: A string which uniquely identifies the client implementation and its version; similar to [HTTP User-Agent](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-5.5.3).

pubkey.description: The validator's BLS public key, uniquely identifying them. 48-bytes, hex encoded with 0x prefix, case insensitive.

validator_index.description: Index of validator in validator registry

committees_at_slot.description: Number of committees at the provided slot

slot.description: The slot at which the validator must attest.

dependent_root.description: The block root that this response is dependent on.
The block root that this response is dependent on.

pubkey.description: The validator's BLS public key, uniquely identifying them. 48-bytes, hex encoded with 0x prefix, case insensitive.

validator_index.description: Index of validator in validator registry

slot.description: The slot at which the validator must propose block.

pubkey.description: The validator's BLS public key, uniquely identifying them. 48-bytes, hex encoded with 0x prefix, case insensitive.

validator_index.description: Index of validator in validator registry

until_epoch.description: The final epoch (exclusive value) that the specified validator requires the subscription for.

fee_recipient.description: An address on the execution (Ethereum 1) network.
An address on the execution (Ethereum 1) network.

pubkey.description: The validator's BLS public key, uniquely identifying them. 48-bytes, hex encoded with 0x prefix, case insensitive.

peer_id.description: Cryptographic hash of a peerâ€™s public key. '[Read more](https://docs.libp2p.io/concepts/peer-id/)

gossip_score.description: Gossip score for the associated peer.

finalized.description: List of finalized nodes in deposit tree

deposit_count.description: Number of deposits stored in the snapshot

execution_block_hash.description: Hash of the execution block containing the highest index deposit stored in the snapshot

execution_block_height.description: Height of the execution block in canonical chain containing the highest index deposit stored in the snapshot
